channel.title: inSite JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [TD-2901] Export Error, and bogus access path to Publications folder
item.description:
Initially, when Pathway is launched from FLEx, the Save in Folder path is incorrect.

In my case, from FLEx, it shows C:\Users\brommerse\Documents\Publications\Nkonya\Scripture. That causes a problem because Pathway cannot write to that user (brommerse).

So, I use the ellipsis button to navigate to my own folder. Then I get the export error shown in the screen shot.

No matter what I've tried, I get this error. So far, E-Book is the only destination I've tried.
item.environment: Testing the 1.1.0.2020 build dated Mar 19th, 2012 with brand new 7.2.3 BTE build
item.summary: Export Error, and bogus access path to Publications folder

comments.comment:
I copied the files per the email, and the first time I tried Pathway, it worked, and then I tried a Root-based version and got this a different Error message. Sorry.

Later, I restarted Pathway with the Shift key pressed down and then was able to export Trash Cans as both Stem and Root based Ebooks. Strange.

Have to copy the recent setting files(DictionaryStyleSettings.xml and ScriptureStyleSettings.xml)
Task completed.
The March 23rd build 1.1.0.328 seems to be OK.

attachment.name: After exporting sucessfully 5 times, this appears. Strange..jpg
attachment.author: marlon_hovland

attachment.name: AFTER installing new files per email.jpg
attachment.author: marlon_hovland

item.title: [TD-2910] Empty Verses cause Paratext export to fail
item.description: I have an error report that I will create from Geoffrey Hunt. He was trying to use Pathway to create Open Office file from Genesis. He hadn't finished translating it but wanted the parts that he had done to be printed. The empty verses caused the transformation to fail. I will create a JIRA issue for this too.
item.summary: Empty Verses cause Paratext export to fail

comments.comment: MHP ...zip can be restored by Paratext. If Genesis is exported, the results in LibreOffice just have a title page and nothing else. This is an error in the transformation when the book includes empty verse tags.
Completed and committed in Git.

item.title: [TD-2855] More spacing issues in EBook output (2)
item.description:
In Root-Based dictionary, I wanted to show glosses in two writing systems, so I duplicated the Definition (or Gloss) line and sent one to English, and the other to Tok Pisin.

As shown in the screen shot, the spacing is good in FLEx, but not in Ebook.

Later: I removed the ugly brackets { } and applied the Dictionary Contrasting style to the Tok Pisin ws, and then the gaps changed (see screenshot).
item.summary: More spacing issues in EBook output (2)

comments.comment:
https://www.jira.insitehome.org/browse/LT-12658
Task fixed by Flex, version 7.2.3.
Well the EBook files are much much better. I will add a superceding issue for other spacing issues I find.

attachment.name: without brackets but with style change.jpg
attachment.author: marlon_hovland

item.title: [TD-2914] BM2 Paratext export to Epub has validation errors and the ebook is empty.
item.description:
See screen shots for errors. In Calibre, I get this message:

calibre, version 0.8.44
ERROR: Could not open ebook: No valid entries in the spine of this EPUB

item.summary: BM2 Paratext export to Epub has validation errors and the ebook is empty.

comments.comment: BM2 Output Epub file attached.
Task completed and code committed in GIT.
The new pathway build of 3/29 seems better, see screen shot. There were a number of validation errors that were disconcerting, but there is content in the ebook.

item.title: [TD-2823] Slow performance exporting to LibreOffice
item.description:
Email from Paul Unger (via LTS list):

"I haven't used Pathway for a while (I had been running v. 0.6.something with FW 6.something). Since I'm now running FW 7.something I upgraded to the latest stable Pathway release (0.7.something). I'm also running LO 3.4. My goodness! I had experienced long waits with Pathway before and have been 'trained' to be patient, but on my W7 x64 with an i5 chip and 4GB of RAM, the Export window went into (Not Responding) mode for about 20 minutes and the Update Guidewords did so for another 20 for a 4000 item lexicon... That's just too long. I'm very interested in a solution! ;-)

Paul"
item.summary: Slow performance exporting to LibreOffice

comments.comment:
Update from Paul:

"Erik,

I don't know if this helps or if it's a different issue, but the main.odt file that was generated by Pathway is full of "Error: Reference source not found". In fact, every 'lexical relation has this error, as do 'complex forms' (e.g., /compound/, /idiom/, etc.). I could see how that could contribute to the slowness. What I don't know is how to fix the broken references... It is a major deal breaker for me. :-(

Paul"

I sent a reply to him, asking if he could run the .epub export just to see if the hyperlinks are broken from the FLEx output or if LO has a problem (the .epub validator catches this condition). We've sometimes seen broken hyperlinks when filters are enabled in FLEx -- I'm not sure if there are other conditions that can cause this.

Dear Paul,
 
This is James from Pathway Team.
 
I am working on TD-2823(Slow performance exporting to LibreOffice), what you reported to Erik Brommers.

Email from Paul Unger (via LTS list):

"I haven't used Pathway for a while (I had been running v. 0.6.something with FW 6.something). Since I'm now running FW 7.something I upgraded to the latest stable Pathway release (0.7.something). I'm also running LO 3.4. My goodness! I had experienced long waits with Pathway before and have been 'trained' to be patient, but on my W7 x64 with an i5 chip and 4GB of RAM, the Export window went into (Not Responding) mode for about 20 minutes and the Update Guidewords did so for another 20 for a 4000 item lexicon... That's just too long. I'm very interested in a solution! ;-)

Paul"

I could not reproduce this error.

Can you send me either your LibreOffice output file(.odt) or your inpur files (.xhtml and .css)?

Your files will be useful to reproduce the bug and fix.

Thank you,
James

Hi Paul,

Thank you. I received main.odt file from your last mail.

I verified that main.odt. I found that,

You are using very old build of Pathway. Your version is 0.7.1.945, which was build on 12-Apr-2011.

Please use latest Pathway build. New build (SetupPw7BTETesting1.0.6) can be downloaded from http://pathway.sil.org/download/latest-sprint-downloads/.

Please download and use.

Thank you for your feedback.
 
With Regards,
James

I verified that main.odt. I found that,

User is using very old build of Pathway. His version is 0.7.1.945, which was build on 12-Apr-2011.

Now it works fast.

item.title: [TD-2900] Crash setting YouVersion as the default destination in Pathway Configuration Tool, with Filter Broken Links preprocessing transformation selected,
item.description: In the configuration tool, I set the default destination as YouVersion, and got a gray error box when I clicked OK. See screenshot for error message and config.
item.environment: I installed the new build today, 3/16. called BTE 1.1.0.2022
item.summary: Crash setting YouVersion as the default destination in Pathway Configuration Tool, with Filter Broken Links preprocessing transformation selected,

comments.comment:
I tested daily build(22nd march, 2012) and the version number : BTE 1.1.0.326.
It is working fine.

In the BTE 1.1.0.328 build dated March 23, YouVersion is no longer a destination I can select.

IF it should be, we need to retest this.

item.title: [TD-2753] More spacing issues in EBook output
item.description:
There is *usually* no space between "whatever" and (semantic domain).
Exceptions:
-- where the "(" follows punctuation, such as a period or colon. However, notice that there is no space when the ( follows a question mark, so not all punctuation is handled the same? Goofy.
-- after some glosses [See the gloss "take.up.one's.cross (sem....."].

There is no space between the [pronunciation] and variant of form, or between [pronunciation] and variant form. See Screenshots 2 and 3. Also,3 has space between the variant forms themselves that is not ideal.
item.environment: Testing the build available on 11/18, but dated 11/17
item.summary: More spacing issues in EBook output

comments.comment: I bumped this up to "Critical" because the problem still exists in various places, and further, Erik was solving spacing issues on a case by case basis--a bottomless pit of "opportunities". What is really needed is a programmatic solution that covers all combinations/permutations of potentially adjacent elements (linked texts, punctuation, non-linked text and so on)....needs some thought.

HOLD

[6:54:45 PM] gtryus: I did move one epub spacing issue (with padding-left) to the Flex project. I showed it to Susanna and she agreed they should address it in the 7.2.3 patch. This one I didn't move because it looked like it had too little space rather than too much but it could be that it is the same issue and when they fix the one issue they will fix this one too. We can mark it as dependant on the other issue if you like and then we can at least put it on hold until the flex issue is resolved.

https://www.jira.insitehome.org/browse/LT-12658
Task fixed by Flex, version 7.2.3.

I added a screen shot to LT-12658 showing that there is a lack of spacing, similar to screen shot 2 in this issue. I'm not sure if the problem is FLEx or Pathway or if the fix is in the 7.2.3 build in the download packages.
As new spacing issues come up, I will add new issues. such as TD-2904.

item.title: [TD-2868] Preprocessing Transformation check box selection set in Config Tool as defaults are not remembered in Export Through Pathway dialog box
item.description:
In the Configuration Tool, I set the defaults so that both check boxes under Preprocessing Transformation in the Processing Options tab were selected.

I closed the dialog box.

In FLEx the when I looked at the Export Through Pathway's version of that tab, both check boxes were cleared.
item.environment: Testing the daily build of March 6th as downloaded from Team City
item.summary: Preprocessing Transformation check box selection set in Config Tool as defaults are not remembered in Export Through Pathway dialog box

So, I tried to export ONLY the reversal index to ebook, and a lengthy message appears in a Pathway message box, with a red/gray X. See screen shot.

I tried it again (export with only Reversal Indexes selected in the Processing Options tab) because the first time I did not capture the error message now in the "GOT IT" screen shot....BUT the second time I got a different message, but it is equally blocking. The message complains about the folder, but it has not changed and previously worked.

item.title: [TD-2866] reversal output has doubled the phonetic brackets
item.description:
From: Cameron and Valerie Hamm [mailto:cameron_hamm@sil.org]
Sent: Wednesday, February 29, 2012 3:09 PM
To: 'G Trihus'; 'Greg Trihus'
Cc: 'Susanna Imrie'; 'Dennis Walters'; 'Erik Brommers'; 'J Samdoss'; jprabhu@ecgroup-intl.com; karthi@ecgroup-intl.com; 'Larry Waswick'; 'Mike Lothers'; 'Philip Perry'; svenkat@ecgroup-intl.com
Subject: RE: Pathway export problem

Greg,

Yes, this resolves the problem. However, now the pronuncation field in the reversal output has doubled the phonetic brackets. However this is easy to remedy with find and replace within LibreOffice before going to PDF. Thanks for your work!

Cam
item.summary: reversal output has doubled the phonetic brackets

comments.comment:
In AkooseDic project, I insert pronunciation for the reversal-form (“disgrace”).

I analyzed the output css file "1531292892mergedFlexRev.css", I found the symbols "[" and "]" are inserted in two places.

1. .pronunciation:after {
         content: "]";
}
      .pronunciation:before {
        content: "[";
}

2. .pronunciation-form:before { content: " [" }
      .pronunciation-form:after { content: "]" }

The flex produces the second brackets only and first one was inserted by our template css file(“dictionary.css”).

This is the reason for producing two brackets for pronunciation field.
Task completed and code committed in GIT

item.title: [TD-2539] Go Bible Genesis and Exodus export for KFY
item.description:
I have been in a Conference for the past two weeks, sharing with everyone about Pathway. While trying to compile an abridged version of Exodus for a colleague, we are getting the following error. Genesis also had missing verses/chapters, but exports fine. Any suggestions welcome. I've attached the backup file in PT with Gen. and Exo.
David Phillips <david_phillips@sall.com>
item.summary: Go Bible Genesis and Exodus export for KFY

comments.comment:
There are a couple major issues in the USFM export that are causing this issue:

- Quite a few verses are missing (some chapters are missing in their entirety).
- Exodus is missing the \h heading. I think this might have been the condition that was causing the export to fail.

I've corrected the issues for Exodus and will add them to this defect. After making these changes, The Go Bible export went through without incident and is visible through the J2ME emulation too.
Sorry, it resolved nicely after adding the header. Thank you very much! It find it odd, though, because none of the other books had a header and yet they exported fine!
Thank you!

item.title: [TD-2811] Include a set of links for Reversal Index "Contents"
item.description: While testing TD-2796, it occurred to me that we do not have a similar Contents set for Reversals Index items.
item.summary: Include a set of links for Reversal Index "Contents"

comments.comment:
[6:40:30 PM] gtryus: b/c 2811 is in the "smart devices" component, Marlon is looking at e-pub. He is seeing that when the user asks for a Reversal, there is no entries created in the "TOC" for navigation.
[6:42:06 PM] gtryus: My understanding is he is expecting it to be like a bilingual dictionary. So you have the two halves where each half is roughly equivalent.
[6:43:23 PM] gtryus: I guess there are really two options for the reversal. The other options is a "finder index" where the only purpose is really to link back to the main entries. In that case there would be one entry in the TOC for the entire reversal but each entry in the reversal should contain a link to an entry in the main part of the dictionary.
[6:45:00 PM] gtryus: In the finder index case, the reversal entries would be very short: just the gloss and a linked headword for the main entry. In the bilingual dictionary the entries would be fuller entries so the person could look up words in either language.
[6:46:37 PM] gtryus: (To really get the full bilingual dictionary, you might really need to create two flex projects. You may want different example sentences in each half of the dictionary and the reversal method doesn't really give you this possibility very easily.)
[6:47:31 PM] gtryus: Nevertheless, I think many people might be happy for the kind of bilingual dictionary that can be created virtually automatically by flex
Task completed and code committed into GIT.
I am now not able to get a reversal index to appear in the ebook file, and created TD-2926 as part of the attempt to test this.

item.title: [TD-2381] Process Front Matter options from Export Through Pathway dialog
item.description:
Once the Export Through Pathway dialog is successfully persisting the values for the Front Matter tab, we need to add code to insert the front matter pages in the exported document:

- Cover image, optionally including the book's title as a "badge" on the image (code for this is in epubexport - it probably just needs to be moved to common code)
- Title page (.xhtml page with the book's title centered on it)
- Copyright info page (.xhtml file specified by the filename -- this will be a straight insert/copy into the exported document)

I'm guessing the code to add these items needs to go in the PreProcessor (?) before calling Export() on the backend.
item.summary: Process Front Matter options from Export Through Pathway dialog

comments.comment:
Code checked in to add this for the epub export (only).

Individual backends will need to call PreExportProcess.InsertFrontMatter(), specifying whether to merge the front matter files into the preprocessedXhtml or to leave them as separate files in the specified output folder. Once the backends have inserted the call to InsertFrontMatter(), this task can be considered complete.

Disabled the UI for unimplemented exports (svn v. 1161).

Individual export types (InDesign, etc.) will need to add the call to PreExportProcess.InsertFrontMatter(), as well as handle the new xhtml content that is inserted. This should be spun off into subtasks.
Removing time estimates for this task. Each export varies in the work and difficulty level - estimation should be done at that level.

Some more information related to this task:

- The .epub export should be generating all three front matter options correctly at this point.
- The GoBible format does not support front matter (cover / title / copyright page). It only supports book/chapter/verse for text, and a simple text string for copyright info (that is retrieved from the Menu / About feature).
PreserveScripture Draft.xhtml - xhtml with embedded front matter content (title page and copyright info page). These are following the Scripture XHTML elements that Jim Albright has been working on.
we will treat Logos as a separate item

item.title: [TD-2802] LibreOffice crashed after exporting Book(S) / Indic language (Telugu) text from Paratext through Pathway
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. In Paratext, open a Telugu project, then Click File-->Export to Pathway.

2. From the Export Book(S) to Pathway window, Select the "Choose Books" radio button, then Click on the "Choose" button

3. In the Books to Export to Pathway window, Select any one of the books from the List of Books list box,(for e.g., Click on "Genesis") then click on the NT Books button, after that click OK button.

4. From Export Book(s) to Pathway window, Click the Ok button will show up the "Export Through Pathway window". Click on the check box then click on the OK button will open the Libreoffice.

5. Click on the "Enable Macros" button from the Libreoffice-security warning window, will show an error message that the LibreOffice crashed.

I have attached the Paratext project backup file as well as the screenshot for reference.
item.environment: Paratext 7.2, Pathway 1.0.2 dated 13.12.11 with FW 7.2 build
item.summary: LibreOffice crashed after exporting Book(S) / Indic language (Telugu) text from Paratext through Pathway

comments.comment:
I and sankar working together
We found issue is related to windows event error(Problem Event Name:BEX).
 Please see "Microsoft_Issue.txt".
Windows7 Service Pack 1 fix the BEX event error.
We installed and tested.
It is working fine.

We found bug in Windows 7 event(Problem Event Name:BEX).
Windows7 “service pack 1” fix the BEX event error.
We installed “windows 7 service pack 1” and tested.
It is working fine.

Retested this Issue in Pathway Version 1.1.0 Dated 15.03.12 along with Paratext 7.2 and I am not able to reproduce the same. But, I noticed that it is working fine with Libre Office Version 3.3 and not in 3.4. (I have changed the LO Version as per karthi (Pathway team) guidance).Since it is working fine, I am closing the Issue. Thanks.

item.title: [TD-2798] Page number is overlap on text line when macro running.
item.description:
Step to reproduce :

1) Open "Gondwana " project and Go to Lexicon → Lexicon edit.
2) Set filter as "num" in "Grammatical info(Full)" column on center of "Entries" pane.
3) Click on "File" → "Export" then "Export' dialog box will be appear and select "Pathway" then click "Export" button.
4) Click on "Ok" button in "Select your Organization" dialog box then select below field in "Export Through Pathway" dialog box.
                 Destination : Open office/LibreOffice
                 Stylesheet : TEST (Please , refer the settings in screeshot-1.jpg)
                 Click on "Ok" button.
5) Here, Page number is overlap on text line in every pages

Note: a.) Macro is enable While opening a libreoffice file
          b.) Reversal Index check box is disabled in "Export Through Pathway" dialog box.
          c.) Page number is set as "Button outside Margin"

Please refer attachment and screenshots.
item.environment: Flex 7.2 BTE version 7.2.0.40891 2011/12/14 and pathway version 1.0.2.1825 (12/13/2011), XP
item.summary: Page number is overlap on text line when macro running.

comments.comment: I and James working together for this task.

I have re-tested this issue in Flex 7.3 BTE Version: 7.3.0.40932 2012/01/23 and Pathway version.0.4.1875 (11/01/2012). I can able to reproduce this issue with same step So I am reopening now. I have attached rar file to reference. Thanks.

Now Right guidewords are shown in header.

Committed revision 1903.

I have retested this issue in 7.2.3 BTE Version: 7.2.3.40982 2012/03/14 and pathway Version 1.1.0.2022(3/15/2012) build. Page number isn't overlap on text line in every pages now. Its working fine. So, This issue has been fixed and closed it. Thanks.

item.title: [TD-2834] Error message box is appear While exporting e.pub when click "OK" on "Font Copyright Warning" dialog box.
item.description:
Step to reproduce :

1) Open Sena 3 project and Go to "Lexicon" → Lexicon edit pane.
2) Click on "File" → "Export" then "Export' dialog box will appear and select "Pathway" then click "Export" button.
3) Click on "Ok" button in "Select your Organization" dialog box then "Export to through pathway" dialog box will be appear.
4) Select destination as "E-Book(.epub)" and Click on "button" at right end of stylesheet list box then "Select layout" dialog will be appear.
5) Click on "Edit layout" button after "Pathway Configuration Tool BTE 7.3.0" will be appear.
6) Click on "Others" → Save As icon on tool bar then new custom stlye will be appear in center of stylesheet pane.
7) Click on info tab at right end and change style "name" and etc... and Click on "Properties" tab and change the "TOC Level" as 3 option and Text alignment as "Right"
8) Now, Back to "Export to through pathway" dialog box by closing other dialog box.
9) Select style sheet as custom name and select check box then click on "OK" button.

Here, Error message box is appear While exporting e.pub when click "OK" on "Font Copyright Warning" dialog box.

Please refer screenshot-1.jpg and video file.
item.summary: Error message box is appear While exporting e.pub when click "OK" on "Font Copyright Warning" dialog box.

comments.comment: Task completed and code committed at revision: 1904.

I have retested this issue in 7.2.3 BTE Version: 7.2.3.40982 2012/03/14 and pathway Version 1.1.0.2022(3/15/2012) build. I didn't get any error message box when clicking "OK" on "Font Copyright Warning" dialog box. Its working fine. So, This issue has been fixed and closed it. Thanks.

item.title: [TD-2799] Libre Office encounter a problem after export the project into pathway through Paratext
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Paratext 7.2 -->Click on File-->Export to Pathway, Export Book(s) to Pathway window opens.

2. Click on the Choose button will open "Books to Export to Pathway" window. Here, Click inside the List

Box (List of Books),now all books are get deselected.

3. Click on the "All Books" button then Click on the OK button, will open the Export Book(s) to Pathway

window, then Click on the OK button will again open the Export Through Pathway window.

4. Click on the Check box under the More button, then Click on the OK button will open the Libre Office

and the process symbol is displayed in the screen for some more times.

5. Click on the Enable Macros button on the new window, will show "Repagination" on the status bar and

suddenly a window appears on the screen with an error message "Libre Office encountered a problem.."

I have attached the screenshot for reference.

I have attached the tested project too.
item.environment: FW 7.2 build dated 14.12.11, Pathway 1.0.2 dated 13.12.11, Paratext 7.2 Upgraded Version - Windows XP SP3
item.summary: Libre Office encounter a problem after export the project into pathway through Paratext

comments.comment:
I and sankar working together
We found issue is related to windows event error(Problem Event Name:BEX).
 Please see "Microsoft_Issue.txt".
Windows7 Service Pack 1 fix the BEX event error.
We installed and tested.
It is working fine.

We found bug in Windows 7 event(Problem Event Name:BEX).
Windows7 “service pack 1” fix the BEX event error.
We installed “windows 7 service pack 1” and tested.
It is working fine.

Retested this Issue in Pathway Version 1.1.0 Dated 15.03.12 and here are my observations:

  As per Karthi (Pathway team) guidance, I uninstalled Libre Office 3.4 (though it is not supported the Pathway Version 1.1.0) and installed Libre Office 3.3 in my system. Then I opened Paratext 7.2 and followed the above steps described by me. Now, I am able to open the Libre office document without any error message.

  I noticed that it will take much time (approximately 25 minutes) to get open the Libre Office document in Windows XP SP3.

   I am not able to reproduce the Issue. Hence, I am closing the same. Thanks.

item.title: [TD-2767] Add data collection about user's installation
item.summary: Add data collection about user's installation

comments.comment:
I think we have to break 2767 into sub issues.
[7:02:10 PM] gtryus: First we have to identify a way to store the information from the user in the Pathway web site.
[7:02:28 PM] gtryus: Then we modify the boot strap program to collect the information.
[7:02:39 PM] gtryus: This can be phase 1.
[7:03:29 PM | Edited 7:04:12 PM] gtryus: The third step is to store usage data in the registry and update it on Pathway web site when user updates Pathway
[7:04:51 PM] gtryus: yes, Pathway web site is based on Wordpress.
[7:05:08 PM] gtryus: So step one could be a word press plugin that allows for restful updates.
[7:06:07 PM] gtryus: Then the fourth step will be to check is user is running the latest version (from time to time) and update the usage data if the Internet is present.
[7:07:52 PM] gtryus: Also if you have other ideas, I would like to hear them too.
Developer will create a sub issue

[7:09:27 PM] gtryus: At boot strap time we want to track the user's installation:
os version, Paratext present?, Flex present?, TE present?
[7:09:57 PM] gtryus: The usage stats will record which destination and which style sheet are used and how often.
Completed the Task.
